Resident
2015 - 2017 Not Recommended Reviewed 11/14/2017
Multiple car break-ins three months ago. More again last week. There have been shootings and armed robberies while I've been here too. Crime keeps happening but nothing changes. It's so poorly lit, no wonder there are so many break-ins. Apartments are nice, location is great, and staff is very friendly/efficient but I don't feel safe outside after dark. I've had to jump out of the way of cars so I didn't get hit (especially at the intersection with the other complex). Lots of liquor bottles and fast food littering the grounds that stays there for days. The dryer they provide keeps burning holes into my clothing and, while I believe in saving water, the washer doesn't even fill enough to cover my wash.

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Verified Resident
2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 09/17/2017
Community is decent. The office staff is pretty good, although difficult to get in contact with via email or phone at any point during the move-in process. You would think that would be when they were the most attentive. Once I moved in and could go into the office in person, everything was very smooth. Maintenance staff is good, they come quickly and are mostly in and out, friendliness depends on who you draw. The apartments themselves are decent. My warning is that you should make sure when you go to tour that the unit you look at is not only the size but the type you will be renting. Some of the 1 bedrooms are renovated with nice new appliances and some don't even have a microwave. This is reflected in the prices somewhat (those also fluctuate on the website randomly and are 'controlled by corporate') so make sure you know what you're getting. The location is good. Its very quick to get on 147 and get into downtown Durham if that's where you need to travel. Not that much to do or eat within a 5 minute drive, but A LOT in under 10 minutes. Overall experience has been good. Other reviews mentioned safety issues but after about two months everything has seemed alright. Also note that there is a mandatory cable charge of 50 dollars a month (just TV and HBO, not internet), when they say trash service they mean a dumpster, not valet trash.

This has been a wonderful community to live in. I feel safe, the maintenance is swift, and the office staff is great! The rent has increased each year I have been here, but improvements have not always benefited the whole. We went from 2 car care bays to one, but gained a dog park. I don't own a dog, so that was a loss for me. The access to the onsite gym is quite a hassle, since it seems the code is always changing due to people giving it out. The most inconvenient part about it is you have to go to the office to get said code. Also, you can no longer pay rent onsite, it must be done via online website. I don't like that. But other than those few things, I enjoy this community very much.

2006 - 2010 Not Recommended Reviewed 03/17/2010
I would never recommend anyone move to Colonial Grand. I lived there many years, and it went up, then back down, then half-way back up. It has improved. The problem isn't so much the residents. A lot of people on here say it's because they're black. Yes, the complex is 98% African American, but it's a long shot to say that's the issue with the complex. I was the only white girl in my building, but all of my neighbors were super nice, polite and respectful neighbors and I never had to deal personally with anyone who was a cruddy neighbor. I DID hear and see plenty thugs there throughout the years, but you're going to have bad seeds everywhere you go. So to say it's because of rap music and noise and because of race, yes it's there, but to say it's everyone is ridiculous. My worst neighbor was a loud white girl when I first moved in! The real problem with the complex is the construction of the apartments. They're cheap. The walls are paper thing, you really can hear your neighbors pee, talk, shower, move, sleep. The way the apartments are laid out your headboard can go on one wall, the same wall your neighbors is on...so when it's jiggy time for them, be ready to hear it. Sounds like someones knocking down a wall with a hammer. You hear a lot of the noise from outside as well, and the hallways....really anywhere. They're cheaply made apartments and silence is not an option at Colonial Grand. You just can't get it. The office staff yes used to be a bunch of bratts when they were a different staff. But the last few years, they were actually really nice and great people. When the property was bought as Alta Trace is when the staff turned bad. Before I left though, everyone there did get problems resolved fast and were super friendly. Just avoid to older blond lady who runs the joint...she'll give you a death stare and thinks she's better than you. But luckily, she was only there a few times when I had to go into the office so I got to avoid her and her catty attitude. If I had to recommend you deal with anyone, I'd say turn to Garret....he's a doll and a little more easy going. I think if you're a younger person who doesnt mind noise then go ahead and move in! But if you enjoy a good nights sleep you may want to look elsewhere. You can live by Southpoint or Brier Creek for only a few bucks more and get a better apartment with more solid construction.

Prospective Resident
Visited 2008 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/04/2010
I will be honest and admit that many times the overly positive reviews are written by staff members trying to appear as residents. I will not do your intelligence the disservice of trying to propagate that thinly veiled facade and will instead just be truthful. My name is Adam and I have been the Service Manager at Colonial Grand at Research Park for almost 2 years now. Many things have changed for the better since the time I arrived and will try to give you an accurate picture of what the property is really like instead of the mix of "I hate this place" and "I love this place" that you get from these reviews. So, here is the breakdown: 1. Parking: Used to be a terrible problem but the property manager started a parking pass program that has gone a long way to solving that problem. Make sure you have a pass and you will be just fine. 2. Noise: Yes we have a few residents that like their music loud, but every complex does. I don't think it is anywhere near as bad as described in some of the reviews, but I suppose if you live next door to one of the few it probably is irritating. 3. Grounds: The picture of the compactor overflow area at the top of the review was accurate for about 2 years ago, but I can assure you that the grounds are picked up thoroughly 6 days a week now and it looks nothing like that now. 4. Service: I just ran last year's service numbers for the complex last week and here they are: 97.7% of service requests completed in 24 hours or less, 99.9% within 48 hours. I take completing my residents requests very seriously and assure you that if you have a service need it will be resolved promptly. It is a beautiful property in a great location. The staff is dedicated to the residents, both office and service staff and I would urge you to look past the extremes in these reviews and come by to check us out for yourself, you will not be dissapointed.

Resident
2008 Not Recommended Reviewed 09/05/2008
I've been here since June 2006. Took an apartment there mainly b/c I worked across the street at GSK -- could walk to work. There were a number of problems with the place when I first moved in, 1 (no burner pans on the electric range) which took them 4 weeks to address. The previous management team I found to be very unprofessional, and I got the distinct sense that many of the office staff had not a clue as to what they were doing. I will say I have noticed a slight change fot the better since management changed -- there appears to be a more professional team in place at the front office. Other than that, I've found the staff to be fairly responsive regarding repair requests and such. However, I don't think I could fully recommend renting here for the following reasons: 1. The dumpster is a mess most days. I consider myself a conscientour sort (double-bag my trash), but it is usually overflowing with trash, and the compactor is broken more times than I care to remember. 2. Tenants -- I've noticed the caliber of tenant declining since I'vestarted living here. Most of my neighbors, and many of the people I encounter living in the complex are nice and courteous, but you have a disruptive few who hang out all hours of the day and night, don't know the meaning of the phrase "trash can", park anywhere they see fit, and just make it miserable for the rest of us. 3. Location -- not very ideal, imho. It's really only close to one notable point of interest, SouthPoint Mall. A bit of a trek from Brier Creek. I've just renewed my lease, but only b/c I'm using this year to save towards the purchase of a house.

Resident
2008 Not Recommended Reviewed 08/01/2008
You may think the buildings are nice enough, the grounds look good, and the staff adequately does their job, but lets talk about whats below the surface. For the first 6 months or so, things went smoothly, then the clientele started a gradual decline. Buy renters insurance. Why? Well its a good idea, but more importantly when your apartment burns to the ground because people are so lazy that they forgo the 5 empty parking spaces, 10 yards from the building, to pull up to the curbs to save them 10 extra feet of walking. There is no chance that a fire truck could make it to some of the buildings. I know, i witnessed it first hand at 3am in the morning when the alarm went off (which started the month long fire alarm escapade) and the truck could not maneuver between the 4 junkers parked in the fire lanes. CG has since painted firezone lines. However to no avail, since people still park their cars within millimeters from the end of the painted line, which still in the way. Thats when the handicapped spaces are already spoken for by someone who is clearly not handicapped. I've seen a few cars on cinderblocks, where their dubs were stolen in the middle of the night, probably by a neighbor. If you have an apartment with a garage, use it. Put the car in the garage, or away from the building. If you have the luxury of owning a flame retardant vehicle feel free to park it outside the garage. Residents will flick their ashes and cigarette buts on the roof of your car. Children will fling poo and charcoal off of the balcony above you ... wait, why would anyone be grilling on the balcony, or allowing their pet to defecate on their patio anyway? I've also caught a few slackers urinating off of the 2nd story balcony during a break from a late night binge. Back to the laziness. Who stole the recycling bins? If you are an environmentally conscious person, who takes the time to seperate your trash from recyclable items, it will annoy you that one day the bins simply vanished. That was about 8 months ago. I guess they weren't that useful since the majority of the residents mistake the words "glass,aluminum,paper" for "throw every piece of crap you can find in here". As well as "cardboard" for "don't struggle that extra 10 feet you lazy sack of poo, just toss all your bags of garbage in front of here". It annoys me beyond belief that people toss their garbage bags on to the ground, when the dumpster is literally 10 more feet. You may also notice a constant beeping from the surrounding apartments. Don't worry, you aren't going insane .. thats your neighbor who is too busy to change the battery in the smoke detectors. They typically just drown out the noise with drum practice, or loud music. If you are an animal person, then you'll really appreciate the many many varieties of dog poo on every grassy area that you can find. Why would someone be considerate enough to clean up after their pets, i mean its good fertilizer right? You'll also enjoy watching the stray cats hunt birds, and rip through all of the out of place trash bags and pick over House Party 5's left over chicken bones that were tossed into the street. If you are a sportsman, feel free to join in the various session of neighborhood streetball. 4th of July is a huge time, drawing 100s of people to someones garage for grilling, wings, 40s and hoops. Enjoy the selection of crotch rockets and hoopties that pump the sick beats at all hours of the evening. If you can get past all of that, please pay the extra $10 per month for the view of a courtyard. That way you can watch your neighbor, who drinks 22oz cans, from brown paper bags, while smoking in his wife beater every day when you get home for work. If really makes the places feel homey ... or homie, whichever interpretation you choose.

2008 Recommended Property Reviewed 07/23/2008
I moved into a 2bed 2bath here at Colonial about two years ago. They put in brand new carpet into our apartment and we never had a single problem in it except 2 lightbulbs went out and a few ac filters, maintenance usually came the very next day. I use the back entrance everyday and have never had one problem with parking, usually I can find the same space everyday. I really don't have any complaints that everyone else has. I was in the clubhouse the other day picking up a package and noticed that they installed new computers in the business center. I can definitely tell a difference in the staff in the past year, their much more helpful than when I initially moved in. The property also looks cleaner and better kept. Unfortunately my work is taking me out of the state and thus I will be moving out, otherwise I would be staying here for another year.

Resident
2006 - 2008 Not Recommended Reviewed 07/19/2008
If we were staying for our entire lease, we would have lived here for two years (we moved here in Dec. '06). When we first moved here it was mostly graduate students. The quality of residents has seriously declined. Don't let them fool you with the fact that the actual apartments themselves are pretty nice - the complex itself is a disaster. In the past year we have had an assortment of unpleasant experience, including seeing our neighbor peeing off their balcony and having a child fling poo off their balcony onto our cars. People park on whatever curb or handicap spot they see (a firetruck could never actually get in front of our building if it needed to). The pool is always full of unsupervised children, many of whom probably don't even live in the complex. I try to never walk around by myself at night because I don't trust the other people that live here. The management staff tries to act professionally, but we have found them to be fairly incompetent. They misplaced our move in inventory that detailed the condition of the apartment when we moved in. They have lost our rent checks. A few months ago they told us they could no longer take two checks for rent - but didn't tell us until after we had already turned in our checks for the month. the next day, after moving money around and writing them a new check for the full amount they notified us that their policy had changed again so they just went ahead and cashed our old checks (this could have been avoided if they gave us our checks back when we had asked for them). We then got to spend the next week trying to stop the old checks and having to get a certified check to pay the rent. Over the past year the fire alarm in our building has gone off at least a dozen times - with no fire. There were multiple nights where it went out for hours. We are terminating our lease to move out, and its definitely worth what it will cost us. If you do decide to live here, make sure you don't have a bedroom that backs up to a stairwell. If you do, you'll know exactly what time your neighbors come home from the club because you will hear them tramping up the stairs. Also, be sure you like hunting for animal poo while you are walking around, because no one that lives here cares to pick it up.

i would have to disagree with some of the previous comments. The staff is friendly and the maintenance guys react comprehensively. The apartments look great, the neighborhood is calm and quiet and the complex is really nice. Despite all these nice words, I would not recommend this place to any of my friends. And here are my reasons: 1) The location sucks. It is far away from everything. The nearest bus stop is 2 miles, gas station is 3 miles, grocery 4 miles, and restaurant 5 miles. Most of the restaurants won't deliver. 2) Contract renewal. I was warned by many but didn't believe until I experienced myself: the rent would go 10% every year. So if you are prepared to pay an extra 70,80 bucks every month after the first year, welcome. 3) Trash. The dump is always overloaded(i wish i had a picture to share with you) and nobody cares to separate the recyclables. 4) Ultra thin walls: Although I had some of the quietest neighbors, I was still able to hear a little too much of their privacy and intimacy.

Resident
2007 - 2008 Not Recommended Reviewed 04/22/2008
When we moved in last year, the complex seemed nice although all the previous tenants complained it had come down miles from where it used to be. Within 9 months here, the quality of the complex continues to sink like a rock. There are still some nice families and young professionals living here, but for the most part neighbors are rude, loud and inconsiderate. It seems they have stopped having high standards for tenants, as the luxury community appears to be mostly populated with thugs. Loud parties at night are frequent, and just this weekend a party spent the night throwing solo cups, trash and chicken bones off their balcony into the parking lot. Trash is everywhere, and parking is poorly planned. Walls and ceilings are thin so noise is always a problem. I always know when two of my neighbors are getting busy, and I can hear another neighbor in their bathroom blowing their nose, etc. The complex no longer feels safe after dark, and many neighbors have told me they have had their car or apartment broken into multiple times. I would say this is an internal problem of the complex, as we are in the middle of RTP and there are few other residential areas around. Parking is so bad, that people park illegally in handicapped spaces or firelanes, and although the management put up notices that this would be enforced with towing, nothing was ever done. I have even called myself to try to have a car towed and the number the management listed as our designated towing company is not open past normal business hours. The maintenance staff is nice and friendly and gets the job done right, but if you want it done quickly you are better off talking to them directly as the office staff will notify them days later of an issue. Generally the office staff is not helpful unless you are thinking about moving there. In the past months, many of the previous amenities such as the business center and recycling have been removed, and hours have been restricted on the gym even though access is card secured. They say they are pet friendly and breed restricted, but they kicked one girl out with a friendly husky but allow other huskies and TONS of pit bulls to stay, some of which are aggressive. There is no consistency. If you have children or want to feel safe, pick another complex. We are leaving as soon as our lease is up, as our rent is increasing and we have found much cheaper, bigger apartments in nicer communities in the area.

Report
Resident
2004 - 2008 Not Recommended Reviewed 04/16/2008
The way in which this property is (isn't) managed is quite surprising. The management sporadically enforces rules on and off, sometimes inventing fees and/or penalties outside your lease contract. You may place a bag of trash outside your door overnight, and discover a $30 "lease violation" bill. However, you may literally have a neighbor that has trash bags outside his/her door for weeks, who never get fined. Did you get a note that a neighbor complained about the noise in your apartment? They won't have records of who it was, or the day or time at which it was to happen. Speaking of records, their photocopier was broken the 3 times I signed leases with them, and they failed to deliver copies as promised all 3 times. The parking situation has gotten out of hand; cars now park at curbs all over. This is not only a driving hazard when you leave in the morning and have to literally squeeze between two cars, but a hazard if the fire department or EMS vehicles need to get into the back of the complex. This has been an issue for over half a year. They once put letters on people's doors stating that these cars would be towed, and then did nothing. Likewise, the trash situation is horrible. Recently, the trash compactor broke, and the complex took 4 months to repair it. In the mean time, industrial trash containers were hauled in, and trash got _everywhere_. Broken glass, metals shards, and rotting foodstuffs were all over the ground. More recently, the complex has decided to completely abandon its recycling program without notification to the tenants. Additionally, they seem incapable of emptying the trash cans at the mailboxes before the point that they literally overflow on the ground. This complex only well maintains the grounds in the front of the complex, so new customers will see it. Trash and litter are pervasive, and courtyards away from the front are often not kept. Mulch is not delivered to these places, so they turn into mud factories. Night time feels dangerous to be out walking a pet; light bulbs are essentially never replaced. Broken light fixtures are never repaired. Do be aware that to live in this complex, your water and cable bill are bundled into your rent; to be late on your cable is to be late on your rent, and default your deal. You must pay for cable; you do not have to option to not pay for it. Recently, the complex increased the cost of water over 100%. While we are in a drought in Durham, the price of the water provided from the utility has not risen. The complex has used the excuse of drought in order to increase their profits directly out of our pockets. I don't recommend this property for families with children. You are likely to have a neighbor complain about the noise your children make through the thin walls, there is trash and dog feces all over the grounds, and you don't want your kids out in the evening when it's dark in the courtyards or parking lots with the burnt-out bulbs. Additionally, the cars driving around looking for parking spaces constantly is another hazard. If you require a repair inside your apartment, you inform one of the desk people, who act very kind and professional while not actually getting your issue taken care of, until you call back a couple times to 'remind' them that you still need someone to come fix it. Bottom line is that they don't work for the tenants, they work for the management company, and they make that fact quite clear. Not only do they not resolve personal tenant issues, but they are incapable/unwilling to resolve property-wide issues. If you consider moving in here, be sure to take a walk around the entire grounds, not just the front, alone without a property manager, and talk to tenants you see around the complex.

Do be aware that to live in this complex, your water and cable bill are bundled into your rent; to be late on your cable is to be late on your rent, and default your deal. You must pay for cable; you do not have to option to not pay for it. Recently, the complex increased the cost of water over 100%. While we are in a drought in Durham, the price of the water provided from the utility has not risen. The complex has used the excuse of drought in order to increase their profits directly out of our pockets. I don't recommend this property for families with children. You are likely to have a neighbor complain about the noise your children make through the thin walls, there is trash and dog feces all over the grounds, and you don't want your kids out in the evening when it's dark in the courtyards or parking lots with the burnt-out bulbs. Additionally, the cars driving around looking for parking spaces constantly is another hazard. If you require a repair inside your apartment, you inform one of the desk people, who act very kind and professional while not actually getting your issue taken care of, until you call back a couple times to 'remind' them that you still need someone to come fix it. Bottom line is that they don't work for the tenants, they work for the management company, and they make that fact quite clear. Not only do they not resolve personal tenant issues, but they are incapable/unwilling to resolve property-wide issues. If you consider moving in here, be sure to take a walk around the entire grounds, not just the front, alone without a property manager, and talk to tenants you see around the complex. Read less

The actual place is very nice and well kept. The lawncare people come about once a week to keep the community beautiful.<br><br>The gym is small, but you'll get enough of a workout with the two treadmills, one ellip and bike. The weights are nice.<br><br>The pool is absolutely gorgeous and I've spent a lot of time there this past summer. <br><br>The apartment has good insulation and blocks out a lot of noise and I can hardly hear my neighbors unless they are stomping around with shoes or play music with extremely high bass. Other than that, I have never heard conversations or the TV. When I have been bothered by extraneous noise, I've asked neighbors to calm it down and they've all been friendly. I did have neighbors on my left who engaged in domestic violence disputes and had to call the police. They were an anomoly though.<br><br>What I don't like about the place is some of the people they rent to. Sometimes people can be real ghetto and loud when they play at the pool or ride up in their cars. <br><br>The only reason NCCU students lived there one year was because every dorm on campus was infested with some bacteria and they had to find housing them in the surrounding area.<br><br>One maintenance guy creeped me out but he left. All the maintenance guys are pretty helpful and I've gotten my stuff taken care of within 48 hours.<br><br>Yes, Cynthia is a space cadet and isn't the most personable person and the pricing could bend a little bit for the current residents. <br><br>The most sucky part about living there is you seriously have to drive ten minutes to get to civilization or to the grocery store. I don't mind the drive anymore because highway 147 is never crowded and it's nice to breeze through and listen to music before getting to the store. Read less

So I moved in here about 2 months ago- what a BIG mistake. First of all there is too much noise; between hearing your neighbors converse in their living room below you or from the sirens of the police cars that come by each night. When I moved in, this seemed like a quite and beautiful place to live. Now it seems like they threaten the residents to be on their best behavior during a certain period of time so they can show people apartments so that it looks like a nice place to live and then after a certain time they can go back to being the animals that they are. Make sure to lock all doors and windows while AT home or away from home. Maintenance doesn't knock before entering and neither do those who are trying to steal from you. Also, make sure that you take ALL valuables with you if you know when maintenance is coming. They feel as if they dont get paid enough so they feel they can take what belongs to you. I know that stuff happens everywhere and that safety is not a guarantee, but, I am from New York City and I felt safer and more comfortable living there in the city than I do here. This complex looks nice, but that's it and looks can and ARE deceiving.

The management will be sure to remind you constantly that you do not own your space. They make a variety of excuses to enter your apartment without your permission. The neighborhood has a lovely slummy feel complete with loitering neighbors, loud music, dog waste on sidewalks...If you are a champion of environmental causes, you´ll be especially charmed by sprinklers that flood the streets and sidewalks, even during rainstorms. The location is in the middle of nowhere. Forget about quick grocery store runs unless you consider a 10-minute drive quick. If you are planning on a daily morning workout, be prepared to vary your workouts as equipment is often in disrepair. Sparkling pool? Yes, along with dirt, balls of hair, and bugs. If you are into soap operas, you will find them right outside of your apartment window, which will inevitably provide you with a view of spouses arguing and several police cars. ALWAYS, ALWAYS be sure to lock both deadbolts (yes, you get two) because the friendly maintenance crew will enter first, knock never. <br>Don´t even consider living here; buy a house in a more convenient location and avoid surprise visits from apartment staff.

Leasing

Welcome to Colonial Grand at Research Park apartment homes in Durham, NC where comfort and convenience is everything. Enjoy amenities such as a resort-style swimming pool, a cyber cafe and a fully equipped workout facility. Colonial Grand at Research Park apartment homes are perfectly positioned adjacent to Research Triangle Park and only minutes away from the areas major universities: Duke, UNC and NCCU. Just down the road from Colonial Grand at Research Park apartment homes you will find outdoor shopping, upscale retailers, movie theaters and great restaurants of the Bull City.

Management Company: MAA

Office Hours Open Now!

  • Sunday: Closed
  • Monday - Friday: 09:00 AM - 06:00 PM
  • Saturday: 10:00 AM - 05:00 PM
